body.p: The following sections describe the control flows for the supported log pages.

section.title: Error Information (log identifier 0x01)
section.p: This log page is used to describe extended error information for a command that completed with error. Extended error information is provided when the More (M) bit is set to ‘1’ in the Status Field for the completion entry associated with the command that completed with an error or as part of an asynchronous event with an Error status type. This log page is global to the device.

This error log may return the last n errors. If the host specifies a data transfer of the size of n error logs, then the error logs for the last n errors is returned. The ordering of the entries is based on the time when the error occurred, with the most recent error being returned as the first log.

fig.title: Get Error Log Information Command Control Flow

table.title: Get Error Log Information Command Control Flow

entry.p: The command is received by one of the Data Managers.
The Data Manager forwards the command to the Admin Command Manager for processing.
The Admin Manager gets current Error Log index from controller memory.
The Admin Manager retrieves requested number of Error Log pages with the oldest page on the top sequence to outgoing buffer.
The Admin Manager checks whether there is any outstanding Asynchronous Event request, clears it if the request is for error information, and sends an Asynchronous Event completion to the host.
The Admin Command Manager issues a DMA request to transfer the error log information to the host.
When the data transfer is complete, the DMA responds with a DMA completion message.
The Admin Command Manager sends a completion queue update request to the Completion Manager.
The Completion Manager replies back to the Admin Command Manager when the completion has been successfully sent to the host.

section.title: Get SMART/Health Information (log identifier 0x02)
section.p: This log page is used to provide SMART and general health information. The information provided is over the life of the controller and is retained across power cycles. The log page will be supported on a global basis. The log page may be supported on a per namespace basis, as indicated in the Identify Controller data structure. To request the global log page, the namespace specified is 0xFFFFFFFF.

Critical warnings regarding the health of the device may be indicated via an asynchronous event notification to the host. The warnings that result in an asynchronous event notification to the host may be configured using Set Features.

Performance of the device may be calculated using parameters returned as part of the SMART / Health Information log. Specifically, the number of Read or Write commands, the amount of data read or written, and the amount of controller busy time allows both I/Os per second and bandwidth to be calculated.

entry.p: The command is received by one of the Data Managers.
The Data Manager forwards the command to the Admin Command Manager for processing.
The Admin Manager loads SMART information from controller memory to local SRAM.
The Admin Command Manager issues requests to each of the Data Managers to obtain their SMART health information.
The Data Managers respond with a SMART update completion message that contains the requested information.
The Admin Command Manager issues a SMART update request to Mapping Manager 0.
Mapping Manager 0 responds to the Admin Command Manager with a message that contains the requested information.
The Admin Command Manager consolidates the SMART health information into a single location in controller memory.
The Admin Command Manager issues a request to write the Data Frame buffer that contains the SMART health information to flash to Mapping Manager 0.
A write operation is issued to the Flash Interface to save the SMART health information.
The Flash Interface responds to the flash write request.
Mapping Manager 0 responds to the Admin Command Manager request to write protocol metadata.

The Admin Manager checks whether there is any outstanding Asynchronous Event request for SMART information. If yes, the Admin Manager clears the request and issues Asynchronous Event completion to the host.
The Admin Command Manager issues DMA requests to transfer the SMART health information to host memory.
The DMA responds to the Admin Command Manager when the transfer is complete.
The Admin Command Manager sends a completion queue update request to the Completion Manager.
The Completion Manager replies back to the Admin Command Manager when the completion has been successfully sent to the host.

section.title: Firmware Slot Information (log identifier 0x03)
section.p: This log page is used to describe the firmware revision stored in each firmware slot supported. The firmware revision is indicated as an ASCII string. The log page also indicates the active slot number. This log page is global to the device.

fig.title: Get Firmware Slot Information Command Control Flow

table.title: Get Firmware Slot Information Command Control Flow

entry.p: The command is received by one of the Data Managers.
The Data Manager forwards the command to the Admin Command Manager for processing.
The Admin Command Manager issues DMA request to transfer the log page information to the host.
When the data transfer is complete, the DMA responds with a DMA completion message.
The Admin Command Manager sends a completion queue update request to the Completion Manager.
The Completion Manager replies back to the Admin Command Manager when the completion has been successfully sent to the host.
